attributes.action: Block Recep Tayyip Erdogan from coming to UK
attributes.background: His double standards on terrorism (by allowing the wounded terrorists in his country), deporting of Kurds (who are 100% against ISIS) and setting the ME very unstable are his violations of International Law. He must not be allowed to speak in UK!

attributes.action: Make government create a Bank of England national high street bank.
attributes.background:
I think the public should have an option to borrow/have mortgage from a private bank or to borrow from a national bank run and owned by government.         
I'd rather borrow from my own country's national bank and pay back with interest, instead of borrowing from foreign owned private banks.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the British public have a right to borrow/have mortgage from government. The Bank of England should have a branch in every high street. 
A national bank created just for small buissness/mortgage borrowing and basic current accounts.
Private banks profit billions pay their Chiefs millions and get bailed out by the public when they get it all wrong.
A nationally owned bank I think would help keep private banks in order.

attributes.action: Start to plan real strategy to deal with Donald Trump as President.
attributes.background: The USA could well be run by Donald Trump in 2017, he, his policies and his supporters are the biggest threat to democracy & world security in the 21st century. We must start planning for this possible outcome and distance ourselves from the United States of America.
attributes.additional_details:
Should Trump become President we should...

Stop buying US:
Weapons;
Goods;
Services; &
Oil (crude)

Remove:
US ran military bases in the UK and vote to remove them across the EU; &
Agreements to use UK airspace / airfields for US military (airforce, army, navy, et al)

Veto:
All US led UN war resolutions; &
All UN tabled resolutions that could result in an outbreak of war or invasion by the US or UN.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A303 now and ask for tenders by the end of this financial year.
attributes.background: A feasibility study to include a twenty four mile detour to include a Salisbury by-pass would not only delay the work, it would also cost more than a tunnel. I have written to the PM and local MPs regarding the A303 but have received negative responses.
attributes.additional_details: In the early 1950s some of the "Stones" we're straightened and had concrete support added, some of the works gang are still alive and photographs of the work are in Andover museum. I think that *EH want to hide the Stones from the A303, giving the traffic vibrations as cause of further damage to the site. Just how much vibration would be generated by excavating a tunnel? I maintained the A303 past the site for ten years and have sent a viable considerably cheaper route!

attributes.action: Want equal shares in profits in houses if a couple divorce with children
attributes.background: I recently went through a divorce and when when me and my ex wife separated it was me who left the house as my children x2 needed a home, so therefore it was better for me to leave. Once we got to court the judge awarded a 70/30 split in the house profits in favour of my ex wife. It seems unfair.
attributes.additional_details: I really think this law needs changing as my question is - What is that other 20% actually gaining for my children? Who is the main benefactor in this? Is it the children, or is it the adults? On a house with profit with or without kids should be 50/50 split. That way then both adults can create homes, instead of the man struggling.

attributes.action: Fine people who misuse A and E departments.
attributes.background: A and E departments are being misused.  This is causing backlogs and ambulance queues. Staff should be allowed to refuse to treat anything but accidents or emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Last week my mother in law waited over 2 hours in an ambulance queue before she was able to be admitted.  While talking to a receptionist on the phone I overheard a patient saying they had come to A and E because they'd had a sore throat for 2 days.  This should be stopped!  A and E stands for accident and emergency the clue is in the title!  They are not doctors surgeries or pharmacies!

attributes.action: Minimum text size for "Excessive consumption may cause a laxative effect" etc.
attributes.background: Important information is often easy to overlook and can cause severe distress and discomfort.  Many sugar-free sweets, for example, are ... "incompatible" ... with a long train journey potentially without toilets.

attributes.action: Require online Parliamentary petitions to count any votes against a proposal
attributes.background: Online Parliamentary petitions are created frequently.  At present, only those people who support a proposal can register their views.  Those who disagree with proposals should be able to register a negative vote which counts against the total requiring a Government response or Parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Allow family members of British Citizens in war zones or camps entry to the UK.
attributes.background: British Citizens are living in camps like Calais & Dunkirk waiting for family members to be granted leave to enter. I'd hope that the government would protect my family in crisis. We do not leave a friend of a friend on the doorstep in the rain. Get families of british citizens out of the camps.
attributes.additional_details:
Further links to Guardian article on this issue: 
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/31/migrants-dunkirk-british-citizens-france-tent-city-iraqi-kurds-uk-passports

attributes.action: Stop current MPs being either be a director or shareholder of a company.
attributes.background:
Vested business interests influencing political decision making appears to be rife and uncontrolled.
MPs having a conflict of interests to be addressed and taken extremely seriously, with consequences of hefty fines and imprisonment.

attributes.action: Help people with UK pensions move their money to their home before they retire.
attributes.background: HMRC has delisted thousands of overseas schemes that could previously accept pension transfers from Britain. This is due to the Qualifying Recognised Overseas Pension Scheme. Which has recently been introduced. Many people started pensions in the UK knowing they would not be retiring in the UK.

attributes.action: Make the DBS filtering system fairer for people with more than 2 convictions.
attributes.background:
People that commit more than one petty offence have to declare this to some employers on application even though their offences may be petty or recorded decades ago.
With prisoners being released early and people getting a slapped wrist for serious offences today, historical offenders stand to lose
attributes.additional_details:
Since being made redundant, my friend has been unable to get another job because 35 years ago, he took a hub cap off a dumped car and on another occasion altered a road tax disk. Employers are unlikely to offer him a job because of it. In fact, a criminal with one serious offence that has lapsed can have his/her record filtered after a period of time.
I think petty recorded crimes recorded over decades ago should be filtered also. The current system is ridiculous and discriminatory.

attributes.action: Lower the age to buy cigarettes to 16.
attributes.background: Why do i have the option to fight for my country before i can buy a pack of fags its just stupid like a understand not lowering the drinking age but no ones going to smoke ten snout n get mwi off cigspin n start fighting at the weekend.

attributes.action: Grant a referendum on UK nuclear deterrent, - too important for mere Politicians
attributes.background: A UK referendum should dictate whether independent nuclear deterrent is maintained or upgraded, - too vital an issue for mere Politicians, - if a referendum on the less important EU matter is appropriate, so should survival of Humankind. Denial means MPs decide to protect UK population from itself?

attributes.action: Allow 'Calais migrants' to enter the UK for the Queen's 90th birthday.
attributes.background: We are being encouraged to have street/village tea parties to celebrate the Queen's birthday. I think something more tangible,useful and humanitarian such as allowing Calais migrants entry to the UK would be a more fitting tribute.

attributes.action: Change the start date of BST to the last Sunday in February ..
attributes.background: BST starts far too late and should start a month earlier. It understandable that we need winter savings but there in sufficient morning light at the beginning of March and summer time should start earlier.

attributes.action: Provide free basic television and radio for patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Currently many patients are charged for television whilst in hospital and for many patients it is costly.  Free radio and television would stop the burden of the cost and the complexity of setting it up.

attributes.action: Pass an Act of Parliament guaranteeing the asylum of Julian Assange.
attributes.background: Julian Assagne has had to seek refugee in the Ecuadorian embassy in London. Now that the UN has said that Assange has been declared to be in arbitrary detention. I call on the UK government and MP's to pass an Act of Parliament to protect him from deportation and thus grant him asylum in the UK.

attributes.action: Government must disclose all details regarding googles tax arrangement
attributes.background: Google PLC are known as "The largest company in the world". Due to vast profits partially generated in the UK. (10% - Ref 1).  It is said that those with the broadest shoulders should be bearing the strain but the google tax deal reveals how hollow those words are.  The deal should be exposed!
attributes.additional_details: Ref 1. http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1288776/000128877615000023/goog10-qq12015.htm - This would make 10% of profits from the UK equal to 5.2 BILLION in profits in 2015.  Attracting a tax liability of 1.04 BILLION for 2015 alone.  However the deal of £130 MILLION for 10 years is just another in a long line of large corporations avoiding their responsibilities.

attributes.action: Stop using Private finance initiatives for investment into public services
attributes.background: Private finance initiatives are inherently poor value for money schemes which use private investment to fund public work but in the long run cost government and allow private firms to profit from tax payer money. Therefore government should move from this short termism culture to reduce the deficit.

attributes.action: Radically overhaul the current frustrating and upsetting 111 phone system.
attributes.background: Employ adequately trained medically qualified call operators that are able to assess, understand and provide vulnerable and ill callers seeking medical advice with an appropriate level of service and advice of where to obtain the relevant care they require.

attributes.action: Provide funding for students' public transport costs
attributes.background: There are financially deprived students who are discouraged from attending University. A number of students use public transport as a means of getting to University. There are some students who board trains with invalid tickets due to little or no money. Public transport is a heavy financial strain.

attributes.action: Regulate imports of clothing from unethical sources.
attributes.background: Thousands of workers in countries such as India are being exploited and being payed close to nothing for their hard work. Their work places are unsafe as shown by the Rana Plaza collapse. We want our government to help stop this and make sure garments coming in to our country are properly sourced.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Savar_building_collapse

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit in the outside lane of a motorway for easier overtaking.
attributes.background: The 70 mile per hour speed limit was introduced back in 1965 and since that time cars have become much safer due to shorter stopping distances and more rigorous safety standards for car manufacturers. Roads have not advanced at the same pace however and are stuck using an outdated speed limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Cars today are also fitted with advanced technologies such as ABS and automatic braking. They have become safer but the roads have not grown to accommodate them. 
It should not be assumed that all vehicles have the same stopping distance and often cars that can achieve higher speeds have better stopping distances. For example a McLaren P1 (sporty car but still a good example) can stop in 30.2 metres while the Highway Code states it should take 102 metres to stop from the same speed.

attributes.action: lift the motorcycle restriction law.
attributes.background: lift the motorcycle restriction law and allow learners and full license holders with a valid cbt to drive any size bike at any age and not have the motorcycle restricted to a certain speed.

attributes.action: Making It illegal for motorcycles to filter on roads
attributes.background: When a motorcycle filters on a road they are making there own lane and putting themselves and others at risk and the Highway Code states pick a lane and stay in it this should of been a law years ago
attributes.additional_details: Some bikes slow down when filtering but most don't and when they hit a car as they did mine and my insurance pays them out you get to thinking how's that right I'm not allowed to filter in a car, van or lorry so why are motorcycles

attributes.action: Require retailers to offer a unconditional refund within 30 days on all items.
attributes.background: I got a faulty item from a fashion store but when I wanted to return the item the next day, they refused to give me a refund on the grounds that they don't do refunds. They even threatened to call the police on me. Consumers need more protection from the law to avoid bad service and unfair trade.
attributes.additional_details: Many retailers offer consumers unconditional returns within a period of time including on sale items. Some retailers like Gerard Darel, however, don't offer refunds in any case. Consumers drive the economy and we deserve a better protection from the government. The UK law should require all the retailers to offer consumers unconditional full refunds within 30 days from the purchase date on all items, as long as the item is in original condition.

attributes.action: Introduce education about the prison system & uk law within secondary education
attributes.background: Adolescents require increased education around the criminal justice system, and a chance to experience through education just what imprisonment can be like first hand, and as a deterrent from offending. Through hearing personal stories from inmates, prison officers and other professionals.
attributes.additional_details:
The government needs to start being pro-active as opposed to reactive when it comes down to teenagers and crime. 

In america this idea is used and has been found to reduce the risk of teens offending and living a life of crime.

"A program in the eastern United States invites young people into a prison to try to scare them away from prison. The goal is to teach them to avoid bad choices and bad influences that could put them behind bars for life" (learningenglish.voanews.com)

attributes.action: Abolish Hospital Car Parking Charges for Disabled People in England
attributes.background: Abolish Hospital Car Parking Charges for vehicles that are registred as Disabled vehicles and display the necessary permit to show this.
attributes.additional_details: Wales and Scotland already have Free Parking for all in their Hospital Car Parks! I am only asking for Disabled exemption to begin with!!!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use, in this the 100th anniversary of WW1 and 75 of WW2, I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves. The petition reads
attributes.additional_details: Such graves at New Southgate cemetery N London have already been overfilled for reuse and an associated memorial demolished

attributes.action: Lodge a complaint with the International Court of Justice against Denmark
attributes.background:
To the UK Government,
We request that the UK lodges a formal complaint with the International Court of Justice in The Hague against the Kingdom of Denmark for violating European community laws. Danish Naval vessels have assisted the hunting of small cetaceans around the Faroese coast.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 4 paragraph 3 of the Treaty of the European Union states that "The Member States have a duty of sincere cooperation and should refrain from any measure outside of EU legislation which could jeopardize the rules of the Union or its objectives".
Sea Shepherd can provide photographic and video evidence that Royal Danish Navy vessels have also assisted the Faroese police in intercepting and arresting Sea Shepherd volunteers (including from the UK) who were trying to uphold European law.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Bar anyone who's used racist epithets/insulted foreign dignitaries from Cabinet.
attributes.background: A Minister of the Crown must be a fit and proper person, and Parliament should have the power to reject the appointment to Cabinet of someone who has used racist language or whose presence in government would impair Britain's diplomatic relations due to their having insulted foreign dignitaries.

attributes.action: Ban Fixed Odds Betting Terminals
attributes.background:
Following the Gambling Act of 2005, Fixed Odds Betting Terminals are a feature in bookmakers' shops on our high streets.
Government should  give Councils powers to ban them from the high street
attributes.additional_details:
FOBTs are called the "crack cocaine" of gambling.
Users can lose hundreds of pounds in only a few minutes and can turn violent when this happens.
FOBTs destroy lives and families.
Government should act to ban them from our high streets.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of Brexit negotiation & allowing a public referendum on the deal
attributes.background: The undersigned insist that David Davis or his successor & any persons that are involved will fully & openly disclose all details of the Brexit deal in detail they have negotiated. We also call on the government to allow the general public a vote on the negotiated deal as its them that are effected.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that it is only fair and right to allow them a vote on the deal that is negotiated in their name as it was back when we joined. People have the right to decide if the deal is the best for the country and the best way the country should go. We would also like to see the implementation of a set percentage of voters that will have to vote and carry the vote say 75% of the entire voting population with at least a 75% turn out of voting population in the UK and its territories.

attributes.action: Allow non resident UK Citizens to also vote on whether the UK Leaves the EU
attributes.background: British people living abroad were NOT allowed a vote and are hugely impacted by the outcome. We form a constituency of people who live a special way of life in the EU - the life that experiences free movement of labour and we well understand free trade benefits. An important voice could not vote.
attributes.additional_details:
I am British, I live in Germany. I have a UK pension, I am likely expected to pay inheritance tax upon death and who knows where I might retire. This decision affects people like me too and we need to have a vote on this matter.
The UK parliament should debate if we are now allowed also a vote which should be integrated retrospectively with the referendum already held, and see how this impacts the referendum result.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: End Legal Aid for failed Asylum seekers and foriegn criminals
attributes.background: They are costing the country million each year and the only one who benefit are the legal profession

attributes.action: Referendums must be clearly won AND not disenfranchise relevant constituents.
attributes.background:
Issues important enough to create referendums should not be won by a simple majority, a clear mandate is required.
Voter Turnout >75% wins with >60%,
Voter Turnout <50% wins with >75% with a sliding scale in between.
AND British Ex-Pats should not be excluded on international issues.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is only meant to affect future referendums including but not exclusive to a 2nd EU referendum.
Many on both sides of the recent campaign called for the argument to be clearly won, before and after the vote.  Uncertainty, resentment and protest vote factors could be minimized by more definitive results.
Also, more than 2 million British Ex-pats were denied the vote despite life changing implications for them and the intentions of the Queen’s Speech of May 2015 Votes For Life Bill.

attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: British summer time should take effect at 4pm on a weekday
attributes.background: It is depressing losing an hours sleep and by changing it to an afternoon it would cheer everyone up, boosting public morale.

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: stop councils using loose chippings as surface repair
attributes.background: Councils need to stop wasting money on surface chipping and do repairs to the road as it damage's vehicles

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: Allocate MPS seat in parliament according to their last name.
attributes.background: Placing those who represent us opposite each-other, in confrontation, creates a division that separates them and that they use as a fence, many times feeling comfortable attacking and shouting to each-other which would dramatically change if you allocate sitting in the house by alphabetical order.
attributes.additional_details:
Symbols, and orders have a strong impact in reality and in the way humans interact and relate to each other. A feasible way to start unifying this country is by simply making the members of parliament sit among members of the "opposition".  
That is how we, the people, that have given you this job, live and interact in society, and reflecting this in the house, would bring us a step closer to negotiate, to have compassion, to stop thinking of rivals and start thinking of building together.
